0.user_question: For a birthday party Tom bought 4 regular sodas and 52 diet sodas. If his fridge would only hold 7 on each shelf, how many shelves would he fill up?

ost_step.1: Calculate the total number of sodas Tom bought. He bought 4 regular sodas and 52 diet sodas, so the total number of sodas is 4 + 52 = 56 sodas.
ost_step.2: Determine how many shelves it takes to hold all the sodas if each shelf holds 7 sodas. To find this, divide the total number of sodas by the number of sodas per shelf. So, 56 sodas ÷ 7 sodas/shelf = 8 shelves.
ost_step.3: Since you can't use part of a shelf when calculating complete full shelves, you'll need exactly 8 shelves to fit all the sodas without any leftovers.

So Tom needs exactly 8 shelves to accommodate all the sodas without any leftovers. The answer is: 8 shelves.
